title: Chinese Embassy donates gifts to the Cabo Verde's SOS Children's Village in December 2019 (Linked to project ID#87915)
description: On December 20, 2019, the Chinese Embassy donated Christmas gifts to the children of the Cabo Verde SOS Children's Village during a visit to São Domingos on the island of São Tiago. The value of this donation and the exact materials donated are unknown.   In 2018, the Chinese Embassy also donated gifts and food at an Embassy Open Event (recorded in the linked project ID#87915).
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
Chinese Embassy donates gifts to the Cabo Verde's SOS Children's Village in December 2019 (Linked to project ID#87915)

# Description
On December 20, 2019, the Chinese Embassy donated Christmas gifts to the children of the Cabo Verde SOS Children's Village during a visit to São Domingos on the island of São Tiago. The value of this donation and the exact materials donated are unknown.   In 2018, the Chinese Embassy also donated gifts and food at an Embassy Open Event (recorded in the linked project ID#87915).
justification: Project involves donation of gifts to children's village with no clear environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of Christmas gifts to SOS Children's Village, social welfare focus

title: China awards 30 Cabo Verde students the 2019-2020 Chinese Government Scholarship
description: In 2019, the Chinese Government Scholarship was awarded to 30 students from Cabo Verde. The send-off ceremony was held on August 19, 2019, and was attended by the Chinese Ambassador to Cabo Verde, the Cabo Verde Minister of Education, and the Cabo Verde Secretary of State for Education. This is the fourth year that the scholarship was granted in Cabo Verde.  The 2018 recipients of the annual scholarship are recorded in the linked project ID#88029.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
China awards 30 Cabo Verde students the 2019-2020 Chinese Government Scholarship

# Description
In 2019, the Chinese Government Scholarship was awarded to 30 students from Cabo Verde. The send-off ceremony was held on August 19, 2019, and was attended by the Chinese Ambassador to Cabo Verde, the Cabo Verde Minister of Education, and the Cabo Verde Secretary of State for Education. This is the fourth year that the scholarship was granted in Cabo Verde.  The 2018 recipients of the annual scholarship are recorded in the linked project ID#88029.
justification: Scholarship program focused on education with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Education-focused scholarship program, no energy or infrastructure components mentioned

title: China trains 150 professionals from Cabo Verde in China in 2019
description: In 2019, 150 professionals from Cabo Verde were selected to visit China to participate in training seminars promoted by the International Training Centre and the Chinese Ministry of Commerce. The professionals include police officers, military personnel, journalists, economist, salespeople, computer and health technicians, and civil servants.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
China trains 150 professionals from Cabo Verde in China in 2019

# Description
In 2019, 150 professionals from Cabo Verde were selected to visit China to participate in training seminars promoted by the International Training Centre and the Chinese Ministry of Commerce. The professionals include police officers, military personnel, journalists, economist, salespeople, computer and health technicians, and civil servants.
justification: Project focuses on professional training and capacity building without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Training seminars for various professions, no energy or infrastructure components mentioned

title: Chinese Embassy donates school supplies to primary school in Castelo Branco in February 2019
description: On February 27, 2019, the Chinese Ambassador to Cabo Verde, Du Xiaocong, attended a handover ceremony to donate 100 "school kits" to a primary school in Castelo Branco, Praia Baixo, one of the poorest communities in the municipality of São Domingos. The donation was intended to improve the living and learning conditions of students, and was received by the Ministry of Education of São Domingos. The value of the donation is unknown.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Embassy donates school supplies to primary school in Castelo Branco in February 2019

# Description
On February 27, 2019, the Chinese Ambassador to Cabo Verde, Du Xiaocong, attended a handover ceremony to donate 100 "school kits" to a primary school in Castelo Branco, Praia Baixo, one of the poorest communities in the municipality of São Domingos. The donation was intended to improve the living and learning conditions of students, and was received by the Ministry of Education of São Domingos. The value of the donation is unknown.
justification: Project is focused on education and social development without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation of school supplies to primary school, focus on improving living and learning conditions

title: Chinese Government provides $40 million grant for Phase 2 of Rural Road Improvement Project (Linked to Project ID#61780)
description: On January 24, 2019, after a bilateral meeting with Chinese Premier Li Keqiang, Prime Minister Hun Sen attended a signing ceremony for an exchange of letters between the Chinese Government and the Cambodian Government for Phase 2 of Rural Road Improvement Project. China’s Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) reportedly committed $40 million of grant funding in support of the project.    The purpose of the project is to repair, build, and improve 18 rural roads — with two layers of asphalt (DBST) — in 6 provinces including Kampong Speu, Kampong Cham, Kandal, Tbong Khmum, Prey Veng, and Svay Rieng. These roads measure 1195 km in length. On October 22, 2019, MOFCOM selected Yunnan Construction and Investment Holding Group Co Ltd (YCIH) as the contractor responsible for project implementation. Hunan Provincial Communications, Planning Survey & Design Institute Co., Ltd. was selected as the contractor responsible for project design. HE Sous Kong, Permanent Secretary of State, HE Dr. Ouk Rabun, Minister of Rural Development, signed a project implementation agreement on August 8, 2019.   Then, on December 1, 2019, construction began.  As of January 2021, construction progress was ongoing and the project was expected to reach completion by May 2022. The project passed a mid-term inspection on December 14, 2021. The Cambodian Ministry of Rural Development then issued a letter to China's Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) on December 28, 2021, which says that 'the construction progress and project quality have been satisfied and appreciated by our Ministry. I understand the Chinese project management company and Chinese EPC contractors, who dispatched competent teams, […] worked hard for the project and achieved good results. Since the beginning of construction, they have overcome the challenges of widely scattered project sites, the vast workload, and the adverse effect of Covid-19.’
staff_comments: 1. This project is also known as the China-Aided Cambodia Rural Road Project-Phase II, the China-Aid Cambodia Rural Road Project-Phase II, and the Second Phase of the Rural Road Renovation Project. The Chinese project title is 中国援柬乡村道路项目二期. The Khmer project title is គម្រោងកែលម្អផ្លូវជនបទជំហ. 2. Chinese Government financing for Phase 1 is captured via Project ID#61780. 3. The December 28, 2021 letter can be accessed in its entirety via https://www.dropbox.com/s/md97x2d660xc319/20220127043954390.png?dl=0.
combined_text:
# Sector
TRANSPORT AND STORAGE

# Title
Chinese Government provides $40 million grant for Phase 2 of Rural Road Improvement Project (Linked to Project ID#61780)

# Description
On January 24, 2019, after a bilateral meeting with Chinese Premier Li Keqiang, Prime Minister Hun Sen attended a signing ceremony for an exchange of letters between the Chinese Government and the Cambodian Government for Phase 2 of Rural Road Improvement Project. China’s Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) reportedly committed $40 million of grant funding in support of the project.    The purpose of the project is to repair, build, and improve 18 rural roads — with two layers of asphalt (DBST) — in 6 provinces including Kampong Speu, Kampong Cham, Kandal, Tbong Khmum, Prey Veng, and Svay Rieng. These roads measure 1195 km in length. On October 22, 2019, MOFCOM selected Yunnan Construction and Investment Holding Group Co Ltd (YCIH) as the contractor responsible for project implementation. Hunan Provincial Communications, Planning Survey & Design Institute Co., Ltd. was selected as the contractor responsible for project design. HE Sous Kong, Permanent Secretary of State, HE Dr. Ouk Rabun, Minister of Rural Development, signed a project implementation agreement on August 8, 2019.   Then, on December 1, 2019, construction began.  As of January 2021, construction progress was ongoing and the project was expected to reach completion by May 2022. The project passed a mid-term inspection on December 14, 2021. The Cambodian Ministry of Rural Development then issued a letter to China's Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) on December 28, 2021, which says that 'the construction progress and project quality have been satisfied and appreciated by our Ministry. I understand the Chinese project management company and Chinese EPC contractors, who dispatched competent teams, […] worked hard for the project and achieved good results. Since the beginning of construction, they have overcome the challenges of widely scattered project sites, the vast workload, and the adverse effect of Covid-19.’
justification: Project focuses on rural road improvement without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Repair, build, and improve 18 rural roads in 6 provinces, general infrastructure focus

title: China Eximbank participates in a $1.56 billion loan syndicate for Phnom Penh–Sihanoukville Expressway financed through PPP (Linked to Project ID#61788, #66726, and #92472)
description: In 2007, China Road and Bridge Corporation (CRBC) undertook a feasibility study for the Phnom Penh–Sihanoukville Expressway Project. Almost a decade later, in 2016, CRBC and the Government of Cambodia signed an investment framework agreement for the project. Then, on January 11, 2018, CRBC and the Government of Cambodia signed a concession agreement for the Phnom Penh–Sihanoukville Expressway Construction Project. Under the terms of the concession agreement,  CRBC agreed to implement the Phnom Penh–Sihanoukville Expressway Project on a ‘build-operate-transfer’ (BOT) basis and finance the project with a mix of debt, equity and grant financing. The concession agreement specifies a 4-year construction period and a 50-year expressway operation/toll collection period.  On January 22, 2019, China’s Ministry of Commerce provided an RMB 600 million ($88,540,000) grant in support of the project (captured via Project ID#61788).  Then, on April 22, 2019, China Development Bank (CDB) and China Eximbank (captured via Project ID#61784) and Cambodian PPSHV Expressway Co Ltd. (柬埔寨金港高速公路有限公司) — a special purpose vehicle and wholly owned subsidiary of China Road and Bridge Corporation (CRBC) that was created on May 11, 2018 — signed a $1.56 billion syndicated loan agreement for the Phnom Penh–Sihanoukville Expressway Project. CDB is lead arranger of the syndicate (captured via Project ID#92472), and Sinosure agreed to provide credit insurance.  CRBC also agreed to make a $600 million equity contribution (captured via Project ID#66726).    The purpose of this project is to construct a 190.6 km (new) expressway that will link Cambodia’s capital, Phnom Penh, to Sihanoukville, site of the nation’s only deep-sea port. More than 90% of Cambodia’s total container traffic passes through Sihanoukville. The Phnom Penh–Sihanoukville Expressway is to be named as Road E4. It will run from Village I, Samrong Krom, Porsenchey, Phnom Penh to Village I, Sangkat III, Sihanoukville. The route will pass through about 8.3 km of Phnom Penh, 9.1 km of Kandal province, 80.8 km of Kampong Speu province, 1.92 km of Koh Kong province, and 89.89 km of Sihanoukville. Built in asphalt concrete with 4 lanes, each in 3.75 meters, the total width of the expressway will be 24.5 meters including the garden in between the opposite lanes. All kinds of vehicles will be able use this expressway at a speed of 100 km to 120 km per hour. The expressway will include 263 pipes, 85 bridges, 6 traffic intersections (linked to National Road 4), another 28 intersections, 20 flyovers, and 237 underground places. Drivers will be able to refill and do stop-overs in between their trips for there will be 4 commercial areas with rest stops, 3 gas stations, and a large parking lot. Other road facilities that will be included are road barriers to ensure the safety of drivers and animals, 4 road maintenance departments, 8 toll gates, and multiple traffic lights and signages. CRBC is the EPC contractor responsible for project implementation.    The project officially commenced on March 22, 2019.  As of June 2021, the project had achieved a 55% completion rate. As of April 28, 2022, the project had achieved a 90% completion rate. Its originally expected completion date was September 2022. However, the expressway was ultimately opened to the public on October 1, 2022 for a month's trial use for free to attract motorists. Since the beginning of the construction period, the project has reportedly created 6,000 jobs. It is expected to create 10,000 jobs after completion. Since the beginning of construction, this project has already provided around 6,000 direct employments, plus around 10,000 jobs after completion. Once the expressway is in operation, commuters and drivers will be able travel between Phnom Penh and Sihanoukville in 90 minutes, as compared to 5 hours without the expressway. All vehicles will be initially be able use the route free of charge for 1 month. After that, toll gates will actively collect fees (at a 20% discount during the first year). The exact fee for the expressway has yet to be confirmed but is expected to be the lowest among other ASEAN expressway fees. Generally, the price set for Phnom Penh – Sihanoukville expressway will be based on the number of kilometers traveled using different vehicles. Toll rates are expected to vary between USD $0.10 per km and USD $0.13 per km.
staff_comments: 1. This project is also known as the PP – SHV Expressway Project. The Chinese project title is 金边-西哈努克高速公路 or 金港高速项目 or 金边 - 西哈努克城高速公路 or 柬埔寨金边至西哈努克港高速公路项目.2. The Shenzhen Urban Planning and Design Institute created a master plan for Shenzhen, China in the early 1990s. In 2019, the Cambodian Government tasked the Shenzhen Urban Planning and Design Institute to reprise that role and design a master plan for Sihanoukville, to transform the port city into the Shenzhen of Cambodia.3. There may be additional bank participants in the loan syndicate. This issue warrants further investigation. Revisit this source (https://ijglobal.com/data/transaction/40586/phnom-penh-sihanoukville-expressway-190km-ppp).4. Hunton & Williams and DFDL served as legal advisers to CRBC and helped it achieved commercial close on the 50-year concession.5. The project achieved financial closure on July 31, 2019.6. The purpose of the RMB 600 million grant, according to the Government of Cambodia’s ODA database, is ‘[t]o work on the construction of crosswalks or tunnels, service areas, traffic safety equipment, and engineering plans. It will increase logistics efficiency in the country and help reduce road accident.’7. Some sources identify the total project cost as $2.019 billion. This issue warrants further investigation.8. Cambodian PPSHV Expressway Co Ltd. was legally incorporated in May 2018.9. The exact size of China Eximbank and CDB’s respective financial contributions to the $1.56 billion syndicated bridge loan are unknown. For the time being, AidData assumes that the 2 members of the lending syndicate contributed equal amounts ($780,000,000).
combined_text:
# Sector
TRANSPORT AND STORAGE

# Title
China Eximbank participates in a $1.56 billion loan syndicate for Phnom Penh–Sihanoukville Expressway financed through PPP (Linked to Project ID#61788, #66726, and #92472)

# Description
In 2007, China Road and Bridge Corporation (CRBC) undertook a feasibility study for the Phnom Penh–Sihanoukville Expressway Project. Almost a decade later, in 2016, CRBC and the Government of Cambodia signed an investment framework agreement for the project. Then, on January 11, 2018, CRBC and the Government of Cambodia signed a concession agreement for the Phnom Penh–Sihanoukville Expressway Construction Project. Under the terms of the concession agreement,  CRBC agreed to implement the Phnom Penh–Sihanoukville Expressway Project on a ‘build-operate-transfer’ (BOT) basis and finance the project with a mix of debt, equity and grant financing. The concession agreement specifies a 4-year construction period and a 50-year expressway operation/toll collection period.  On January 22, 2019, China’s Ministry of Commerce provided an RMB 600 million ($88,540,000) grant in support of the project (captured via Project ID#61788).  Then, on April 22, 2019, China Development Bank (CDB) and China Eximbank (captured via Project ID#61784) and Cambodian PPSHV Expressway Co Ltd. (柬埔寨金港高速公路有限公司) — a special purpose vehicle and wholly owned subsidiary of China Road and Bridge Corporation (CRBC) that was created on May 11, 2018 — signed a $1.56 billion syndicated loan agreement for the Phnom Penh–Sihanoukville Expressway Project. CDB is lead arranger of the syndicate (captured via Project ID#92472), and Sinosure agreed to provide credit insurance.  CRBC also agreed to make a $600 million equity contribution (captured via Project ID#66726).    The purpose of this project is to construct a 190.6 km (new) expressway that will link Cambodia’s capital, Phnom Penh, to Sihanoukville, site of the nation’s only deep-sea port. More than 90% of Cambodia’s total container traffic passes through Sihanoukville. The Phnom Penh–Sihanoukville Expressway is to be named as Road E4. It will run from Village I, Samrong Krom, Porsenchey, Phnom Penh to Village I, Sangkat III, Sihanoukville. The route will pass through about 8.3 km of Phnom Penh, 9.1 km of Kandal province, 80.8 km of Kampong Speu province, 1.92 km of Koh Kong province, and 89.89 km of Sihanoukville. Built in asphalt concrete with 4 lanes, each in 3.75 meters, the total width of the expressway will be 24.5 meters including the garden in between the opposite lanes. All kinds of vehicles will be able use this expressway at a speed of 100 km to 120 km per hour. The expressway will include 263 pipes, 85 bridges, 6 traffic intersections (linked to National Road 4), another 28 intersections, 20 flyovers, and 237 underground places. Drivers will be able to refill and do stop-overs in between their trips for there will be 4 commercial areas with rest stops, 3 gas stations, and a large parking lot. Other road facilities that will be included are road barriers to ensure the safety of drivers and animals, 4 road maintenance departments, 8 toll gates, and multiple traffic lights and signages. CRBC is the EPC contractor responsible for project implementation.    The project officially commenced on March 22, 2019.  As of June 2021, the project had achieved a 55% completion rate. As of April 28, 2022, the project had achieved a 90% completion rate. Its originally expected completion date was September 2022. However, the expressway was ultimately opened to the public on October 1, 2022 for a month's trial use for free to attract motorists. Since the beginning of the construction period, the project has reportedly created 6,000 jobs. It is expected to create 10,000 jobs after completion. Since the beginning of construction, this project has already provided around 6,000 direct employments, plus around 10,000 jobs after completion. Once the expressway is in operation, commuters and drivers will be able travel between Phnom Penh and Sihanoukville in 90 minutes, as compared to 5 hours without the expressway. All vehicles will be initially be able use the route free of charge for 1 month. After that, toll gates will actively collect fees (at a 20% discount during the first year). The exact fee for the expressway has yet to be confirmed but is expected to be the lowest among other ASEAN expressway fees. Generally, the price set for Phnom Penh – Sihanoukville expressway will be based on the number of kilometers traveled using different vehicles. Toll rates are expected to vary between USD $0.10 per km and USD $0.13 per km.
justification: The project is primarily focused on transportation infrastructure development without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of 190.6 km expressway with standard road infrastructure, no specific renewable energy or environmental components mentioned

title: China Eximbank provides RMB 622 million government concessional loan for Preah Vihear Province Reservoir Development Project
description: On December 13, 2018, China Eximbank and the Government of Cambodia signed an RMB 622 million preferential loan framework agreement for the Preah Vihear Province Reservoir Development Project. Then, on January 22, 2019, and China Eximbank and the Government of Cambodia signed an RMB 622 million government concessional loan (GCL) agreement for the Preah Vihear Province Reservoir Development Project. The borrowing terms of the GCL were as follows: a 1.25% interest rate, a 7-year grace period, and a 20-year maturity. The borrower was expected to use the proceeds of the GCL to finance a $97,978,000 commercial contract between Cambodia's Ministry of Water Resources and Meteorology and a consortium consisting of Guangdong Foreign Construction Co., Ltd. and Guangdong Yuantian Engineering Co., Ltd. According to the Government of Cambodia’s ODA Database, China Eximbank made three loan disbursements between 2019 and 2021: an RMB 124,400,000 loan disbursement in 2019, an RMB 248,800,000 loan disbursement in 2020, and an RMB 124,400,000 loan disbursement in 2021. The lender was originally scheduled to make an additional disbursement worth RMB 124,400,000 in 2022.   The purpose of the project is to build a dam on the Sen River in northern Cambodia that flows through Preah Vihear and Kampong Thong provinces. More specifically, the scope of the project includes the construction of a concrete dam with a length of 50 meters, a width of 7 meters, a maximum height of 24.5 meters, and construction of a total of 03 sluice gates, with each sluice measuring 4 meters x 4 meters. The dam (left) is 998.6 meters long, 7 meters wide and 11 meters high. The reservoir capacity can maintain approximately 256. 9 million cubic meters of water and can supply approximately 143, 323 hectares of agricultural water in the wet season and 22,878 hectares in the dry season. In terms of benefits, with this large water storage capacity, the dam is expected to contribute significantly to flooding prevention and water supply in some areas downstream. According to the Preah Vihear provincial administration, the reservoir is located in Preah Vihear province, but most of the water flowing through this irrigation project will cover most areas in Kampong Thom province.   In addition to serving agriculture and flooding disaster relief purposes, the dam will also be used for tourism purposes. Guangdong Foreign Construction Co., Ltd. and Guangdong Yuantian Engineering Co., Ltd.  are the EPC contractors responsible for project implementation.  Construction began on November 1, 2019.  As of June 2020, the project had achieved a 41.5% completion rate. By December 2021, the project had achieved an 86% completion rate. The project was originally expected to reach completion by December 31, 2022. However, this date was eventually pushed back to December 17, 2024.
staff_comments: 1. This project is also known as the Reaksa Reservoir Development Project. The Chinese project title is 柬柏威夏省瑞萨水库发展项目. The Khmer project title is អភិវឌ្ឍន៍អាងទឹករក្សា នៅខេត្តព្រះវិហារ. 2. This China Eximbank loan is not included in the China’s Overseas Development Finance Dataset that Boston University's Global Development Policy Center published in December 2020.
combined_text:
# Sector
WATER SUPPLY AND SANITATION

# Title
China Eximbank provides RMB 622 million government concessional loan for Preah Vihear Province Reservoir Development Project

# Description
On December 13, 2018, China Eximbank and the Government of Cambodia signed an RMB 622 million preferential loan framework agreement for the Preah Vihear Province Reservoir Development Project. Then, on January 22, 2019, and China Eximbank and the Government of Cambodia signed an RMB 622 million government concessional loan (GCL) agreement for the Preah Vihear Province Reservoir Development Project. The borrowing terms of the GCL were as follows: a 1.25% interest rate, a 7-year grace period, and a 20-year maturity. The borrower was expected to use the proceeds of the GCL to finance a $97,978,000 commercial contract between Cambodia's Ministry of Water Resources and Meteorology and a consortium consisting of Guangdong Foreign Construction Co., Ltd. and Guangdong Yuantian Engineering Co., Ltd. According to the Government of Cambodia’s ODA Database, China Eximbank made three loan disbursements between 2019 and 2021: an RMB 124,400,000 loan disbursement in 2019, an RMB 248,800,000 loan disbursement in 2020, and an RMB 124,400,000 loan disbursement in 2021. The lender was originally scheduled to make an additional disbursement worth RMB 124,400,000 in 2022.   The purpose of the project is to build a dam on the Sen River in northern Cambodia that flows through Preah Vihear and Kampong Thong provinces. More specifically, the scope of the project includes the construction of a concrete dam with a length of 50 meters, a width of 7 meters, a maximum height of 24.5 meters, and construction of a total of 03 sluice gates, with each sluice measuring 4 meters x 4 meters. The dam (left) is 998.6 meters long, 7 meters wide and 11 meters high. The reservoir capacity can maintain approximately 256. 9 million cubic meters of water and can supply approximately 143, 323 hectares of agricultural water in the wet season and 22,878 hectares in the dry season. In terms of benefits, with this large water storage capacity, the dam is expected to contribute significantly to flooding prevention and water supply in some areas downstream. According to the Preah Vihear provincial administration, the reservoir is located in Preah Vihear province, but most of the water flowing through this irrigation project will cover most areas in Kampong Thom province.   In addition to serving agriculture and flooding disaster relief purposes, the dam will also be used for tourism purposes. Guangdong Foreign Construction Co., Ltd. and Guangdong Yuantian Engineering Co., Ltd.  are the EPC contractors responsible for project implementation.  Construction began on November 1, 2019.  As of June 2020, the project had achieved a 41.5% completion rate. By December 2021, the project had achieved an 86% completion rate. The project was originally expected to reach completion by December 31, 2022. However, this date was eventually pushed back to December 17, 2024.
justification: Project primarily focuses on water management and agricultural support without clear energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of dam and reservoir for flood prevention, water supply, and agricultural irrigation; includes tourism component

title: Chinese government provides financial support for the Council of Ministers Bodyguard Building Project
description: On January 23rd 2019, the Council of Ministers Bodyguard Building Project was officially completed. The Certificate of giving-receiving bodyguard building of the Council of Ministers was signed by Vissoth and Chinese Minister of Commerce Zhong Shan on Jan 24, 2019..

# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
Chinese government provides financial support for the Council of Ministers Bodyguard Building Project

# Description
On January 23rd 2019, the Council of Ministers Bodyguard Building Project was officially completed. The Certificate of giving-receiving bodyguard building of the Council of Ministers was signed by Vissoth and Chinese Minister of Commerce Zhong Shan on Jan 24, 2019..

title: Chinese government donates 4th batch of materials to the Cambodian Senate in 2019
description: On June 13th, 2019, the Chinese Government donated the 4th batch of materials worth $620,000, including 120 desktop computers, 120 laptops, 120 laser printers, and 5 multi-functional printers Five photocopiers and 12 pick-up trucks to the Senate of Cambodia. The handover ceremony for the fourth Senate material project in Cambodia was held in Phnom Penh. The Second Vice-President of the Cambodian Senate, Tep Ngorn, and the Economic and Commercial Counselor of the Embassy of Cambodia, Li An attended the ceremony and delivered speeches ("援柬埔寨第四届参议院物资项目交接仪式在金边举行").
staff_comments: The Chinese project title is '援柬埔寨第四届参议院物资项目'.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
Chinese government donates 4th batch of materials to the Cambodian Senate in 2019

# Description
On June 13th, 2019, the Chinese Government donated the 4th batch of materials worth $620,000, including 120 desktop computers, 120 laptops, 120 laser printers, and 5 multi-functional printers Five photocopiers and 12 pick-up trucks to the Senate of Cambodia. The handover ceremony for the fourth Senate material project in Cambodia was held in Phnom Penh. The Second Vice-President of the Cambodian Senate, Tep Ngorn, and the Economic and Commercial Counselor of the Embassy of Cambodia, Li An attended the ceremony and delivered speeches ("援柬埔寨第四届参议院物资项目交接仪式在金边举行").
justification: Project involves donation of office equipment and vehicles to government institution, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of computers, printers, and vehicles to Cambodian Senate, categorized as government and civil society sector
